Description: The Federal Trade Commission announced complaints and proposed court orders barring four national retailers from mislabeling and advertising rayon textiles as made of  bamboo, and requiring them to pay civil penalties totaling $1.3 million.

Private Litigation Case Title: Tschudy v. J.C. Penny Corporation, Inc. et al
Notes: Dispute concerned payment for unused vacation days when a worker left the company.

Anjum et al v. J.C. Penny Company, Inc. et al
Joshua Munoz v. J.C. Penney Corporation, Inc. et al
Ramirez v. JC Penney Corporation Inc et al

Description: J.C. Penney agreed to pay $100,000 to settle allegations of price scanner errors. Half of fine would be waived if the company maintained a scanning accuracy rate of at least 96 percent.
Info Source: Michigan Attorney General Jennifer Granholm Announces Settlement With J.C. Penney Over Scanning Errors, PR Newswire, July 11, 2000 (via Nexis).

Description: A group of major retailers and a group of jewelry manufacturers joined a settlement involving the presence of lead in costume jewelry sold to children.

Century 21, JCPenney, and Petland Discounts agreed to pay a total of $120,000 as part of a settlement in which they agreed to take significant steps to ensure that each of their New York stores complies with the accessibility requirements and design standards set forth by the Americans with Disabilities Act. The announcement did not specify how the amount was to be divided among the companies. Here we assume it was split evenly among them.

Company: JCPenney Direct Marketing Services, LLC and Stonebridge Benefit Services, Inc.
Description: JCPenney Direct Marketing Services, LLC and Stonebridge Benefit Services, Inc. agreed to jointly pay $2.9 million in settlement of alleged violations of Iowa's Buyers Club Law by enrolling consumers onto monthly memberships without clear disclosure.

Info Source: Contained in data received from the agency on October 14, 2020 in response to an open records request.
